mod_channels: these are channels where mod/non-public commands are allowed
admin_channels: admin-only channels (not automatically considered mod channels)
discord.channel_output: channel ID for general bot messages (technical/audit mostly)
discord.channel_test: channel ID for general testing purposes (mostly unused, some commands are allowed here as well as their normal allowed channels)

core.name: KazTronExampleBot
core.daemon_user: For daemon mode, Linux/UNIX username to switch to (optional, leave blank to keep executing user)
core.daemon_group: For daemon mode, Linux/UNIX group to switch to (optional, can leave blank)

welcome.channel_welcome: channel ID for public welcome messages
welcome.channel_rules: channel ID for users to read rules (linked to in welcome msg)

filter.channel_warning: channel ID for MODERATOR filter warning/delete notifications

dice.channel_dice: channel ID where dice are allowed

role_name1.join_msg: Message to send user when the user successfully joins the role.
role_name1.leave_msg: Message to send when the user successfully leaves the role.
role_name1.join_err: Message when the user tries to join but is already member of the role.
role_name1.leave_err: Message when the user tries to leave but is not a role member.
role_name1.join_doc: Help string for the join command.
role_name1.leave_doc: Help string for the leave command.
group: etc. - command to group the join/leave commands under, must be Group classes - Optional
role_name1.name of another argument here: include other arguments to pass to the discord.ext.commands.command() decorator

role_name2.join_msg: Message to send user when the user successfully joins the role.
role_name2.leave_msg: Message to send when the user successfully leaves the role.
role_name2.join_err: Message when the user tries to join but is already member of the role.
role_name2.leave_err: Message when the user tries to leave but is not a role member.
role_name2.join_doc: Help string for the join command.
role_name2.leave_doc: Help string for the leave command.
group: etc. - command to group the join/leave commands under, must be Group classes - Optional
role_name2.name of another argument here: include other arguments to pass to the discord.ext.commands.command() decorator

modtools.channel_mod: ID of channel for mod notifications (like timed unbans)

modnotes.channel_log: channel ID - for channel to log all new records to (read-only ideally?)

sprint.role_follow: role name - people who want to get notified about new sprints
sprint.report_time: time at which reports are generated weekly, default 17:00

voicelog.channel_text: text channel ID to output voice status messages to
voicelog.role_voice: Name of the role to assign while in voice channels
